raw_text:
Triple triumph for Little Britain
 
 Top TV cult hit Little Britain has triumphed over The Office at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards.
 
 The BBC show beat The Office Christmas Special in the best TV comedy category and took the people's choice award. Matt Lucas and David Walliams also jointly won best TV comedy actor over The Office creator Ricky Gervais, who won a special award for writing. It was also a good night for Ant and Dec who clinched two awards, including best comedy entertainment personality. The Geordie duo also secured best comedy entertainment programme for Saturday Night Takeaway, beating I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!, which they also host, and the BBC's Have I Got News For You.
 
 The ceremony was presented by Jonathan Ross from ITV's London Studios headquarters on the capital's South Bank. Little Britain began life as a radio series on Radio 4, with Walliams and Lucas playing a range of misfit characters from an alternative Britain. It was later commissioned for BBC Three, where it proved a huge success, with the second series also shown on BBC One. After receiving his award for best TV comedy actor with Walliams, Lucas said: "It's a great honour to be nominated alongside Ricky Gervais and Martin Clunes."
 
 The show also won the people's choice award, which is the only gong on the night voted for by viewers. Speaking after receiving the award for best comedy, Walliams said: "It was a real shock but I don't think we deserved to beat The Office which is a great show and more than just a comedy. It's a beautiful piece of work." Gervais and The Office co-writer Stephen Merchant received a special award for writing, presented by Noel Gallagher and Tom Stoppard. Gervais said: "The show has won an awful lot of awards in the last couple of years, too much. It's got embarrassing to be honest." Other winners at the awards included Caroline Quentin, who took home best TV comedy actress for Life Begins and Von Trapped.
 
 Catherine Tate, from The Catherine Tate Show, was also nominated for the same award, but she did walk away with best comedy newcomer, over James McAvoy from Shameless (Channel 4) and Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding from The Mighty Boosh (BBC Three). Nighty Night was named Britain's best new TV comedy over ITV1 shows Doc Martin and Life Begins. But Doc Martin won best TV comedy drama, over Jonathan Creek (BBC One) and Shameless. Winner in the best international comedy category was The Simpsons, beating Sex and the City and Curb Your Enthusiasm. The prize was accepted by Matt Groening, creator of The Simpsons, who also received an outstanding contribution award from scientist Stephen Hawking, who has been featured in the series. School of Rock was voted best comedy film beating Shaun of the Dead and Shrek 2.
 
 Matt Lucas & David Walliams (Little Britain, BBC Three)
 
 Caroline Quentin (Life Begins/ Von Trapped, ITV1)
 
 Ant & Dec (Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway/ I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here!, ITV1)
 
 Catherine Tate (The Catherine Tate Show, BBC Two)
 
 Nighty Night (Baby Cow Productions, BBC Three)
 
 Little Britain (BBC Three)
 
 Doc Martin (Buffalo Productions, ITV1)
 
 Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway (Granada, ITV1)
 
 The Simpsons (Twentieth Century Fox, BBC Two/Sky One/Channel 4)
 
 School Of Rock
llama3.2:1b: Little Britain won awards at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards.
It beat The Office Christmas Special in the best TV comedy category and took the people's choice award.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams also won best TV comedy actor over Ricky Gervais, who won a special award for writing.
The ceremony was presented by Jonathan Ross from ITV's London Studios headquarters on the South Bank of London.
Little Britain began life as a radio series on Radio 4 and later became a successful show on BBC Three before being shown on BBC One.
It also won awards in several categories, including best comedy entertainment programme for Saturday Night Takeaway.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams received awards for their work on Little Britain, with Lucas winning the award for best TV comedy actor alongside Ricky Gervais.
The show's success also led to Ant and Dec securing two awards, including one as comedy entertainment personalities from I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!.
llama3.2:3b: Little Britain wins top awards at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards beating The Office.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams won best TV comedy actor, while Ant & Dec took home two awards including best comedy entertainment personality and Saturday Night Takeaway.
Little Britain also won the people's choice award.
Other winners include Caroline Quentin for best TV comedy actress and Doc Martin for TV comedy drama.
gemma2:2b: Little Britain won the Best TV Comedy award at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards.
The show also won the People's Choice Award.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams won Best TV Comedy Actor, while Ant & Dec won awards for Best Comedy Entertainment Personality and Best Comedy Entertainment Programme.
Ricky Gervais received a special award for writing on The Office.
Other notable winners included Caroline Quentin (Life Begins), Catherine Tate (The Catherine Tate Show), Nighty Night (ITV1), and the Simpsons (BBC Two/Sky One/Channel 4).

Matt Lucas and David Walliams were nominated for best TV comedy actor while Ricky Gervais was named best writer.
Ant & Dec won people's choice award, followed by Caroline Quentin in the same category and Best New TV comedy newcomer.
The show also got special recognition for its comedy entertainment programme "Saturday Night Takeaway," beating "I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!"
Other nominees include Colin Firth, "Sex and the City" and "Curb Your Enthusiasm," while "School of Rock" came in second.

Catherine Tate is nominated for best comedy newcomer but wins best comedy actress instead.
Little Britain beats The Office to win several awards, including people's choice award and special writing prize.

BBC show won in best TV comedy category and took people's choice award.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams jointly won best TV comedy actor over Ricky Gervais, who received a special award for writing.
Ant & Dec clinched two awards, including best comedy entertainment personality.
The Geordie duo secured best comedy entertainment programme with Saturday Night Takeaway, beating I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!
and have co-hosted Have I Got News For You.
Little Britain started as Radio 4 series, later successful on BBC Three.
Caroline Quentin won best TV comedy actress for Life Begins, while Catherine Tate received the award for best comedy newcomer.
School of Rock was voted best comedy film over Shaun of the Dead and Shrek 2.
The Simpsons took best international comedy category from Sex and the City and Curb Your Enthusiasm.
Doc Martin prevailed in best TV comedy drama over Jonathan Creek and Shameless.
opencoder:1.5b:
Triple triumph for Little Britain

Top TV cult hit Little Britain has triumphed over The Office at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards.
The BBC show beat The Office Christmas Special in the best TV comedy category and took the people's choice award.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams also jointly won best TV comedy actor over The Office creator Ricky Gervais, who won a special award for writing.
It was also a good night for Ant and Dec who clinched two awards, including best comedy entertainment personality.

The Geordie duo also secured best comedy entertainment programme for Saturday Night Takeaway, beating I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!, which they also host, and the BBC's Have I Got News For You.
The ceremony was presented by Jonathan Ross from ITV's London Studios headquarters on the capital's South Bank.
Little Britain began life as a radio series on Radio 4, with Walliams and Lucas playing a range of misfit characters from an alternative Britain.
It was later commissioned for BBC Three, where it proved a huge success, with the second series also shown on BBC One.
Speaking after receiving the award for best TV comedy actor with Walliams, Lucas said: "It's a great honour to be nominated alongside Ricky Gervais and Martin Clunes."
After losing the people's choice awards, Walliams said: "It was a real shock but I don't think we deserved to beat The Office which is a great show and more than just a comedy.
It's a beautiful piece of work."
Gervais and The Office co-writer Stephen Merchant received a special award for writing, presented by Noel Gallagher and Tom Stoppard.
Gervais said: "The show has won an awful lot of awards in the last couple of years, too much.
It's got incredibly humbling to be honest."
Other winners at the awards included Caroline Quentin, who took home best TV comedy actress for Life Begins and Von Trapped.

Catherine Tate, from The Catherine Tate Show, was also nominated for the same award, but she did walk away with best comedy newcomer, over James McAvoy from Shameless (Channel 4) and Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding from The Mighty Boosh (BBC Three).
Nighty Night was named Britain's best new TV comedy over ITV1 shows Doc Martin and Life Begins.
But Doc Martin won best TV comedy drama, over Jonathan Creek (BBC One) and Shameless.
Winner in the best international comedy category was The Simpsons, beating Sex and the City and Curb Your Enthusiasm.
The prize was accepted by Matt Groening, creator of The Simpsons, who also received an outstanding contribution award from scientist Stephen Hawking, who has been featured in the series.
School of Rock was voted best comedy film beating Shaun of the Dead and Shrek 2.

Matt Lucas & David Walliams (Little Britain, BBC Three)

Caroline Quentin (Life Begins/ Von Trapped, ITV1)

Ant & Dec (Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway/ I'm A Celebrity, Get Me Out Of Here!, ITV1)

Catherine Tate (The Catherine Tate Show, BBC Two)

Nighty Night (Baby Cow Productions, BBC Three)

Little Britain (BBC Three)

Doc Martin (Buffalo Productions, ITV1)

Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway (Granada, ITV1)

The Simpsons (Twentieth Century Fox, BBC Two/Sky One/Channel 4)
smollm:1.7b: The 2019 British Comedy Awards were held on the 3rd of December 2018 at the BBC Studios in London.
The ceremony was presented by Jonathan Ross from ITV's London Studios headquarters on the South Bank of the Thames.
The show also received a special award for Best TV Comedy Actor with Walliams and Lucas, who won the People's Choice Award for Best TV Comedy Actor.
The show also won the people's choice award for Best TV Comedy Actress with Gervais and The Office (BBC One), who were nominated by Noel Gallagher and Tom Stoppard.
Other winners at the awards included Catherine Tate, who took home Best TV Comedy Drama for Life Begins, and Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding from The Mighty Boosh (BBC Three).
Nighty Night was named Britain's Best New TV Comedy over ITV1 shows Doc Martin and Life Begins/Von Trapped.
The ceremony also featured a special performance by comedian and actor, John Cleese, who performed at the end of the night to conclude the awards.

The show also received several nominations for Best British Comedians, including:

* Best British Comedians (Best in Show) - David Tennant, James McAvoy, and Noel Fielding from The Mighty Boosh
* Best British Comedians (Best in Comedy) - John Cleese, Graham Norton, and Simon Peeker from ITV1 shows Doc Martin and Life Begins/Von Trapped
* Best British Comedians (Best in Comedy Drama) - David Tennant, James McAvoy, and Noel Fielding from The Mighty Boosh

The ceremony also featured several performances by comedians, including:

* John Cleese performing at the end of the night to conclude the awards
* Simon Peeker performing as a guest judge for the Best British Comedians (Best in Show) award
* Graham Norton performing as a guest judge for the Best British Comedians (Best in Comedy) award
* Noel Fielding performing as a guest judge for the Best British Comedians (Best in Comedy Drama) award
deepseek-r1:1.5b: The 15th annual British Comedy Awards saw *Little Britain* triumph over *The Office*, securing the best TV comedy actor award for Matt Lucas & David Walliams, while also winning multiple awards including best TV comedy program and people’s choice.
The ceremony was held in London, with Jonathan Ross hosting it from ITV's London Studios headquarters on the South Bank.
tinyllama:1.1b: The British comedy show Litttle Britain has won the best TV cult hit award at the 20th annual British Comeedy Awards, taking home the title over The Office Christmas Special.
Triple winners were Matt Lucas and David Wallows from the BBC show, which beat two other nominees in the same category - I'm A Celerybritie... Get Me Out Of Here!
and Have I Got News For You.
The programme also received a special award for best TV comedy actor, with Jason Manford winning the prize for his role as an alternative Britain.
Ant & Dec took home the best comedy entertainment personalities accolade, while Catherine Taté from The Catheather Taté Show was nominated for best newcomer in the same category.
Finally, the ITV1 drama Doc Martin won the BBC Three best TV comedy drama award, over Shameless and Sex and the City.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Based on the provided text, the summary is as follows: "Little Britain triumphed at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards, beating The Office Christmas Special and winning best TV comedy category.
Matt Lucas and David Walliams also clinched the people's choice award in this category.

Ant & Dec won best comedy entertainment personality for their Saturday Night Takeaway performance, while show hosts Matt Lucas and David Walliams won best comedy entertainment programme for Saturday Night Takeaway."

granite3.1-dense:2b: Little Britain, a popular BBC show by Matt Lucas and David Walliams, won three awards at the 15th annual British Comedy Awards: best TV comedy, people's choice, and joint best TV comedy actor (with Ricky Gervais).
The Office's Christmas Special also competed in the best TV comedy category but lost.
Ant and Dec received two awards for their work on Saturday Night Takeaway, winning best comedy entertainment personality and best comedy entertainment programme.

Other notable winners included Caroline Quentin for Life Begins/Von Trapped, Catherine Tate for The Catherine Tate Show (best newcomer), Nighty Night for Britain's best new TV comedy, and The Simpsons as the top international comedy.
